so i guess this is just an upscale?

No its no upscale, it's genuine resolution. Quality is good for this size. But indeed misses a lot of detail en has severe artifacts.
IMHO low-bandwidth HD movies need at least about 2mbit/sec (1Gig per hour) to benefit the high res.

Quality is watchable but not HD, fast action doesn't look flawless. 700mb or 1 gig file size would be better, but its 720p which is nice. Too bad its a tv rip which means it lost quality compared to disc rip. It is definitely watchable on 42 inch at 1080p output. Thanks for the good work.

beware! i don't know what you lot are watching this guys uploads on?! I am watching off of a LaCinema Classic HD, through HDMI to a 37" Sony TV. With these i am getting poor quality! Pixelated blacks and over-sharpened edges. I will stick to the 1GB+ file sizes, until someone can actually deliver on this kind of promise! Nice try, thanks for sharing, it's close but it's not quite there yet. If only you didn't over-sharpen and lower the export size so much!
let the onslaught commence!
